Modification_Detail.description: Added lid_references to insts hiscale-ca hiscale-lefs hiscale-lems

Changed inst LIDs from u:n:p:c:i:instID.scID to u:n:p:c:i:scID.instID Changed LIDs from urn:nasa:pds: to urn:esa:psa: And per "Guide toPDS4 Context Products" v1.7, changed all lidvid_reference to lid_reference
Updated schema version. Adding missing "agency" references. Description updated.

Instrument_Host.name: ULYSSES
Instrument_Host.description:
The Ulysses spacecraft, launched on October 6, 1990, is a spinning spacecraft operating at 5 rpm, equipped for long-range communication and power via a High-Gain Antenna (HGA) and Radioisotope Thermoelectric Generator (RTG). Its design prioritizes electromagnetic cleanliness and minimizes radiation from the RTG with a 5.6 m radial boom for sensors and additional booms for conducting experiments. The spacecraft is structured to balance its mass between launch and deployed configurations, with a total launch mass of 367 kg.
Data communication occurs through X-band and S-band frequencies, supporting telemetry and ranging capabilities. The spacecraft is designed for autonomous operations, including failure detection and system reconfiguration. The structure is a box-type with an aluminum honeycomb platform, with a thermal control system to manage temperature for subsystems and experiments.
Power is generated by the RTG, initially providing 280W and decreasing to 250W over time. Communication systems include redundant components for reliability, and the command and data-handling subsystem manages telemetry, on-board data storage, and spacecraft operations. The Attitude and Orbit Control Subsystem (AOCS) maintains Earth pointing and spin rate, while nutation dampers help mitigate oscillation issues.
Since launch, some notable issues have included nutation disturbances and “Disconnect Non-Essential Loads” events, which temporarily limit power to the scientific payload. The spacecraft has successfully undergone various tests and checks, with full commissioning declared in January 1991.
